intro: Thesium karooicum, commonly known as the Karoo thesium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in the Karoo region, where it thrives in open, sunny habitats. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
